title: Worm tooth
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Worm_tooth/zh-CN "Worm tooth/zh-CN")

| ) [![Worm tooth.png](/images/c/cb/Worm_tooth.png)](/wiki/File:Worm_tooth.png) |                                                        |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------ |
| Name                                                                          | worm tooth                                             |
| Appearance                                                                    | worm tooth                                             |
| Damage vs. small                                                              | 1d2                                                    |
| Damage vs. large                                                              | 1d2                                                    |
| To-hit bonus                                                                  | 0                                                      |
| Weapon skill                                                                  | [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife")                           |
| Size                                                                          | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")            |
| Base price                                                                    | 2 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                                        | [20](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                            |
| Material                                                                      | [undefined](/wiki/Undefined "Undefined")               |

A **worm tooth** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of an undefined [material](/wiki/Material "Material"), and uses the [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"). A worm tooth or [stack](/wiki/Stack "Stack") of worm teeth can be turned into a powerful [crysknife](/wiki/Crysknife "Crysknife") by reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant weapon](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_weapon "Scroll of enchant weapon") while wielding it.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Worm teeth are now made of [bone](/wiki/Bone "Bone").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 Origin](#Origin)
- [5 Variants](#Variants)
  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

Worm teeth are not randomly generated. Killing a [long worm](/wiki/Long_worm "Long worm") in a manner that leaves a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") will also [generate a worm tooth](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop") on the same square.

A crysknife that leaves the inventory will revert to a worm tooth; [fixed](/wiki/Fixed "Fixed") crysknives only have a 1⁄10 chance of reverting.

## Strategy

In its natural state, a worm tooth does little damage, and is even more useless against [thick-skinned](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned") monsters - while it is possible to [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") them with sufficient skill in knives, the low base damage severely limits their usefulness. Players planning to make extensive use of crysknives will naturally seek out a means of obtaining worm teeth. While a crysknife is inferior to many artifact weapons and generally not worth [wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") for, it still has some solid use as a secondary weapon when #[twoweaponing](/wiki/Twoweaponing "Twoweaponing"), and it can serve as a primary weapon for roles such as [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer"); certain conducts can also complicate or prevent artifact weapon use.

It is possible to farm worm teeth by splitting larger worms in half, though sometimes this may result in the worm "shrinking" from losing its tail segments. While using a means of [create monster](/wiki/Create_monster "Create monster") or waiting for them to spawn could work, long worms are [quite rare](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency") and generally only spawn if the average of the player's level and the dungeon level is 10 or higher. The most consistent means of generating long worms is [reverse genocide](/wiki/Reverse_genocide "Reverse genocide"), which yields an average of 5 worm teeth per scroll.

## History

The worm tooth first appears in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and earlier versions, including some variants based on these versions, worm teeth did not stack.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Worm teeth become stackable in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"), qualifying for multishot bonuses.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Sandworm (Dune)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sandworm_\(Dune\) "wikipedia:Sandworm (Dune)")***

The worm tooth and long worm originate from [Frank Herbert](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frank_Herbert "wikipedia:Frank Herbert")'s *[Dune](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dune_\(novel\) "wikipedia:Dune (novel)")* series of novels. In the setting of *Dune*, the Fremen, a group of people inhabiting the desert planet Arrakis, have adapted to using the sharp teeth of dead sandworms in order to produce the sacred knives they call crysknives.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), a cursed -4 worm tooth named Storm Brand can be found in the Chamber of Junk within the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest"). The [Wyrm Caves](/wiki/Wyrm_Caves "Wyrm Caves") [branch](/wiki/Branch "Branch") also contains four random [worms](/wiki/Worm "Worm"), which can include long worms that can provide a source of worm teeth.

[Shopkeeper services](/wiki/Shopkeeper_services "Shopkeeper services") can be used to convert worm teeth into crysknives without altering their enchantment.

## Encyclopedia entry

\[The crysknife] is manufactured in two forms from teeth taken from dead sandworms. The two forms are "fixed" and "unfixed". An unfixed knife requires proximity to a human body's electrical field to prevent disintegration. Fixed knives are treated for storage. All are about 20 centimeters long.

\[ Dune, by Frank Herbert ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/objects.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 140](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/src/objects.c#line140 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/src/objects.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 113](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dothrow.c#L113): *Any stackable non-ammo weapon can be multishot*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Worm tooth

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
)
Name worm tooth
Appearance worm tooth
Damage vs. small 1d2
Damage vs. large 1d2
To-hit bonus 0
Weapon skill knife
Size one-handed
Base price 2 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 20
Material undefined

A worm tooth is a type of weapon that appears in NetHack. It is made of an undefined material, and uses the knife skill. A worm tooth or stack of worm teeth can be turned into a powerful crysknife by reading a non-cursed scroll of enchant weapon while wielding it.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Worm teeth are now made of bone.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Origin
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
  • 6 Encyclopedia entry
  • 7 References

Generation

Worm teeth are not randomly generated. Killing a long worm in a manner that leaves a corpse will also generate a worm tooth on the same square.

A crysknife that leaves the inventory will revert to a worm tooth; fixed crysknives only have a 1⁄10 chance of reverting.

Strategy

In its natural state, a worm tooth does little damage, and is even more useless against thick-skinned monsters - while it is possible to multishot them with sufficient skill in knives, the low base damage severely limits their usefulness. Players planning to make extensive use of crysknives will naturally seek out a means of obtaining worm teeth. While a crysknife is inferior to many artifact weapons and generally not worth wishing for, it still has some solid use as a secondary weapon when #twoweaponing, and it can serve as a primary weapon for roles such as Healers; certain conducts can also complicate or prevent artifact weapon use.

It is possible to farm worm teeth by splitting larger worms in half, though sometimes this may result in the worm "shrinking" from losing its tail segments. While using a means of create monster or waiting for them to spawn could work, long worms are quite rare and generally only spawn if the average of the player's level and the dungeon level is 10 or higher. The most consistent means of generating long worms is reverse genocide, which yields an average of 5 worm teeth per scroll.

History

The worm tooth first appears in Hack 1.0.

In NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions, including some variants based on these versions, worm teeth did not stack.[1] Worm teeth become stackable in NetHack 3.6.0, qualifying for multishot bonuses.[2]

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Sandworm (Dune)

The worm tooth and long worm originate from Frank Herbert's Dune series of novels. In the setting of Dune, the Fremen, a group of people inhabiting the desert planet Arrakis, have adapted to using the sharp teeth of dead sandworms in order to produce the sacred knives they call crysknives.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, a cursed -4 worm tooth named Storm Brand can be found in the Chamber of Junk within the Lawful Quest. The Wyrm Caves branch also contains four random worms, which can include long worms that can provide a source of worm teeth.

Shopkeeper services can be used to convert worm teeth into crysknives without altering their enchantment.

Encyclopedia entry

[The crysknife] is manufactured in two forms from teeth taken from dead sandworms. The two forms are "fixed" and "unfixed". An unfixed knife requires proximity to a human body's electrical field to prevent disintegration. Fixed knives are treated for storage. All are about 20 centimeters long.

[ Dune, by Frank Herbert ]

References

  1. ↑ src/objects.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 140
  2. ↑ src/dothrow.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 113: Any stackable non-ammo weapon can be multishot

A '''worm tooth''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is made of an undefined [[material]], and uses the [[knife]] [[skill]]. A worm tooth or [[stack]] of worm teeth can be turned into a powerful [[crysknife]] by reading a non-cursed [[scroll of enchant weapon]] while wielding it.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Worm teeth are now made of [[bone]].}}

==Generation==
Worm teeth are not randomly generated. Killing a [[long worm]] in a manner that leaves a [[corpse]] will also [[Death drop|generate a worm tooth]] on the same square.

A crysknife that leaves the inventory will revert to a worm tooth; [[fixed]] crysknives only have a {{frac|10}} chance of reverting.

==Strategy==
In its natural state, a worm tooth does little damage, and is even more useless against [[thick-skinned]] monsters - while it is possible to [[multishot]] them with sufficient skill in knives, the low base damage severely limits their usefulness. Players planning to make extensive use of crysknives will naturally seek out a means of obtaining worm teeth. While a crysknife is inferior to many artifact weapons and generally not worth [[wishing]] for, it still has some solid use as a secondary weapon when #[[twoweaponing]], and it can serve as a primary weapon for roles such as [[Healer]]s; certain conducts can also complicate or prevent artifact weapon use.

It is possible to farm worm teeth by splitting larger worms in half, though sometimes this may result in the worm "shrinking" from losing its tail segments. While using a means of [[create monster]] or waiting for them to spawn could work, long worms are [[Monster frequency|quite rare]] and generally only spawn if the average of the player's level and the dungeon level is 10 or higher. The most consistent means of generating long worms is [[reverse genocide]], which yields an average of 5 worm teeth per scroll.

==History==
The worm tooth first appears in [[Hack 1.0]].

In [[NetHack 3.4.3]] and earlier versions, including some variants based on these versions, worm teeth did not stack.{{refsrc|src/objects.c|140|version=NetHack 3.4.3}} Worm teeth become stackable in [[NetHack 3.6.0]], qualifying for multishot bonuses.{{refsrc|src/dothrow.c|113|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=Any stackable non-ammo weapon can be multishot}}

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Sandworm (Dune)}}
The worm tooth and long worm originate from [[wikipedia:Frank Herbert|Frank Herbert]]'s ''[[wikipedia:Dune (novel)|Dune]]'' series of novels. In the setting of ''Dune'', the Fremen, a group of people inhabiting the desert planet Arrakis, have adapted to using the sharp teeth of dead sandworms in order to produce the sacred knives they call crysknives.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], a cursed -4 worm tooth named Storm Brand can be found in the Chamber of Junk within the [[Lawful Quest]]. The [[Wyrm Caves]] [[branch]] also contains four random [[worm]]s, which can include long worms that can provide a source of worm teeth.

[[Shopkeeper services]] can be used to convert worm teeth into crysknives without altering their enchantment.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
[The crysknife] is manufactured in two forms from teeth taken from dead sandworms.  The two forms are "fixed" and "unfixed". An unfixed knife requires proximity to a human body's electrical field to prevent disintegration.  Fixed knives are treated for storage.  All are about 20 centimeters long.
|[ Dune, by Frank Herbert ]
}}
